content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 5 to node 17 in the provided graph is:

5 -> 7 -> 17

This path has three nodes (5, 7, and 17) and uses two edges (5 -> 7 and 7 -> 17). Please note that this is the shortest path regardless of the order in which the nodes are traversed. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the shortest path will be different.

The shortest path from node 17 to node 5 in the provided graph is:

17 -> 15 -> 7 -> 5

This path has three nodes (17, 15, and 5) and uses three edges (17 -> 15, 15 -> 7, and 7 -> 5). Please note that this is the shortest path regardless of the order in which the nodes are traversed. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the shortest path will be different.
